JobFullDesc: As one of the world’s leading asset managers, we are solely dedicated to delivering an investment experience that helps people get more out of life. If you're looking for challenging work, smart colleagues, and a global employer with a social conscience, explore your potential at InvescoYour RoleThe Senior Analyst, FP&A – Americas is responsible for financial planning, forecasting, reporting and analysis, as well as developing and maintaining relationships with key business partners within North America (NA) Institutional, NA Operations, Canada and Finance & Corporate Strategy (FCS). In addition, this position will be actively involved in the quarterly and annual fund board reporting (15c).You will be responsible for: Evaluate supporting groups’ financial results against strategic key performance indicators (e.g. revenue impact, asset growth drivers, sales to target, product drivers), to understand key drivers of performance. Conduct financial and strategic analyses to support significant business decisions (e.g. financial modeling, new product initiatives, cost benefit analysis). Make recommendations regarding alternative courses of action. Analyze operational results and relevant trends to identify, understand and proactively address risks and improvement opportunities to achieving the supporting groups’ financial objectives with FCS and business leaders. Identify and analyze cost drivers for the supporting groups to optimize resource allocation and business efficiency and to inform investment decisions. Create, interpret, and deliver management reporting in the form of presentations, performance dashboards, and other visual tools for business leaders, including senior executives. Partner with the Global Business Services (GBS) organization and Americas Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) teams to prepare the supporting groups’ budgets and implement adjustments to monthly forecasts where needed. Partner with FP&A Americas and Product & Market Research to develop and prepare quarterly and annual fund board reporting, including the 15c expense review. Improve and restructure existing processes to achieve synergies and efficiencies across the organization.The experience you bring: Minimum of 5+ years of Finance experience with a concentration in management reporting, quantitative analysis, scenario planning, and decision modeling. High level of proficiency in Microsoft Office including Excel, Access, and PowerPoint. Knowledge of Oracle Financials and/or Hyperion Planning preferred. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail. Strong verbal and written communication skills, presentation skills and organization skills. Ability to work independently as well as in a complex team, across functions and geographic locations. Proactive in identifying issues and developing solutions. Quick learner and self-starter. Excellent work ethics and time management. Multi-task oriented in a flexible and high-pressure environment. Strong interest in the asset management industry. Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance; Graduate degree preferred. CPA or CFA preferred.What’s in it for you?Our people are at the very core of our success.
